e4: Adopting the new policy of reporting unbiased earnings would improve the company's credibility and ethical standing, ultimately enhancing investor trust and aligning with regulatory standards. Although there may be initial confusion among some investors, proactive communication and education efforts could mitigate these challenges, fostering a more transparent and reliable investment environment.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should be transparent, truthful, and fair, providing accurate information without manipulation to allow all investors, regardless of their level of sophistication, to make informed decisions. It should avoid practices that could mislead or create an unequal advantage. Furthermore, communications about any changes in reporting should be clear and widespread to ensure that all stakeholders are well-informed and able to adjust their expectations and decisions accordingly.
e6: What specific strategies will be implemented to effectively communicate the change in reporting policy to all investors, especially retail investors? How will we monitor and evaluate the impact of the new policy on investor perception and company valuation in both the short and long term?
